result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric S Dalton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric S Dalton appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. 
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation. SPD has not appointed counsel at this time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric S Dalton appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. As of today, defendant is now eligible for SPD appointment. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel by Zoom, Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court is down and unable to hear this case.  Defendant appeared in person and has not hired private counsel.  Defendant given next court date and zoom information.  Case scheduled for Status of Counsel Hearing on 9/14/2022 at 1:30 pm by zoom.

Defendant Eric S Dalton in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference.
Defendant does not qualify for a state public defender. Court held colluqy with defendant to determine eligibility for a court appointed attorney
Defendant request time to hire private counsel. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Eric S Dalton in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge *, Branch *. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/01/2022@2:30p
